com.googlecode.csse460_2010.server
Class Stirling

java.lang.Object
  com.googlecode.csse460_2010.server.Stirling

public class Stirling
extends java.lang.Object

Stirling is the main game engine. After starting the server, Stirling will instantiate all the necessary elements for the game. N.B.: The name originates from the compression engine of the same name.

Author:
Christopher Rabotin

Method Detail

addPlayer

public static void addPlayer(Client p)
Adds a player to list of players.

Parameters:
p - an instance of Client which represents the new player.

attackDaemon

public static java.lang.String attackDaemon(Player p,
                                            Attack a)
This function attacks the daemon which is in the room of player p with the given attack a. The daemon will reply to that attack if it is still alive. It is not synchronized because if it were the game would become a turn by turn game. However, the access to functions isAlive and attack from the daemon class are synchronized. In other words, is two players attack the same daemon at the same time, one will have to wait during the execution of his attack on the given daemon before this function returns.

Parameters:
p - the player launching the attack
a - the attack used by player p
Returns:
the result of the attack.

checkAllDaemonsDead

public static void checkAllDaemonsDead()
Checks whether all the daemons are dead. If so, than the game is over. If the game is over, than a new game will start after the restart time specified in the server configuration XML file.

endGame

public static void endGame(Client whoasked)

getNoPlayers

public static int getNoPlayers()
Gets the number of players.

Returns:
returns the number of current players.

getPlayersFormatted

public static java.lang.String getPlayersFormatted()
List of all the players, their health points and their current room.

Returns:
the list of players formatted in raw data format.

getServerPort

public static int getServerPort()

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
In the main function, Stirling starts by calling the XML parser. If no argument is given, than the default serverConfig.xml file is used as the configuration file.

Parameters:
args - you can specify the XML to use OR another port number. You can't specify both.

multicast

public static void multicast(java.lang.String msg)
This messages enqueues the message msg as a multicast message to all users. It is not synchronized because it is only called by Stirling, which is static and has only one thread.

Parameters:
msg - multicast message

processClientInput

public static java.lang.String processClientInput(Player player,
                                                  java.lang.String inputLn)
This function processes the client input, which is read from the socket.

Parameters:
player - the player who's input is being processed
inputLn - the input to be processed
Returns:
a message for the client

rmPlayer

public static void rmPlayer(Client p)
Removes a player to list of players.

Parameters:
p - an instance of Client which represents the player to be removed.
